comments.commentBody: Just for kicks I looked up the definitions for "treason". It's an inflammatory charge,  but the opposition has the obligation to basically support the function of government. "Government" might be a worthwhile concept for the GOP to research.

You obviously didn't watch the Hagel hearing--he lied (his words have been factchecked), hedged, backtracked, and appeared to have no grasp of international affairs and history.  I, along with many, disagree with John Kerry's ideology, but agree that he is qualified for State--that is why he was easily confirmed by both Repubs and Dems.  Hagel, to use Collins' analogy, was a clueless clown.  Any nominee for such an important position should be grilled, yes, grilled thoroughly as to his past and present mindset, actions, and words.  The Dems like to say that this type of vetting has never occurred before, which is laughable.  Dems have done it to Repubs and Repubs have done it to Dems for many years.  As long as the questioners don't lie about the nominee, this is not only acceptable, it should be mandatory.  As Obama likes to point out, Hagel is a Republican, so, using your logic, one would think that the Repubs would embrace him.  The fact that they don't could mean only that they really distrust this man to act in the best interest of the U.S..

Or on a better cruise ship, on a sunny day, Mitch loses the election to Ashley Judd, McCain announces his retirement due to untreatable distemper, and Lindsay the Ubiquitous, recently seen on TV warning gun owners of coming hordes of marauders, ( you know, those people) turns camera shy and retires to a monastery.
Hey, it could happen.
KA

I think the House and Senate GOP are possessed by evil.

The obstruction remains Mitch McConnell's, no matter whose face is at the forefront of any given debate. Ted Cruz, Lindsay Graham, love the limelight and the sound of their own voices. John McCain got the limelight during the confirmation hearing. He got to turn, in public, against his former best friend. Now that others have turned on him even more, he feels obligated to sound fair and come to his defense. Whatevs!

Whether it's the Sequester, Hagel, Gun Control or any of the myriad of issues of the day, at the core, we know it is Grand Wizard Mitch who is orchestrating chaos from his bunker.

We're days away from a self-inflicted double dip.

Blame McConnell. He owns this mess.
I think its time for Democrats to accuse Mr. Cruz of some very nasty stuff. All they have to do is make it up and keep at it till people believe them. Fight fire with fire.

Little surprise he has no record of military service . . . he's a larval coward who poses as a bully.

For issuing such public personal insults, he deserves to be called out to duel --

but my strong suspicion is that he'd run along home to Texas and hide . . .

Caliber is important.

They say Ted Cruz is very smart and that he attended Princeton and Harvard. But he comes from Texas where political evangelism and incompetence reign. This is the land of Tom Delay, Louie Gohmert and John Cornyn.

You can measure caliber by their logic and the lexicon used by the individual and his belief in the tenets of the Republican Party Platform. It's a terrible platform and Cruz is obnoxious. He is in the same class of bright and bad actor as Darrell Issa from California.

John Cornyn, Ted Cruz and Darrell Issa are never going to be elected to any higher office or ever hold a cabinet position. But the GOP sends them in as their pit bulls in order to obtain TV footage and give Rush and Roger Ailes some prime time material. It's all orchestrated by the GOP PR consultants. They use this to retain loyalty and get contributions. They could care less about what you or I think.

The big question is will their voting base continue to erode -- naturally, as they run out of under-educated folks to join up?

Just tried to post a justification of why we voted for Sen Cruz. Anyone who claims to be from Texas commenting here, I don't believe really is. I gave a very logical explanation without bomb throwing of why we voted for Sen Cruz and why I continue to support him. After Chuck Hagel's questioning I don't believe he should be Sec of Defense - talk about embarassment. John Kerry is just a poltics as usual and after Bengazi I hope he at least gives help to our diplomats when they beg for support.

We need two political parties to oversee each other etc. One of ours is badly fractured and in need of help. Get rid of the extremest and people will listen. They
don't like being associated with this tripe.
a filibuster not because they have any real evidence but because they want to go on a fishing expedition.

Ted Cruz is originally from Canada?

Well, there go his presidential ambitions thanks to that pesky part of the Constitution which requires the President to be a native-born citizen!

To which I say, thank goodness!

The on-going melodrama of foaming-at-the-mouth-Republicans is getting pretty tired.

They wrap themselves in the flag and accuse others of being "unpatriotic", see media conspiracies and "tyranny" around every corner, and are eternal victims in an unfriendly, dangerous world full of "bad guys"

In other words, they are a bad, sad joke.
Born in Canada to a Cuban father and an American mother, Senator Cruz is probably one of the few, if not the only US senator who holds citizenship in three countries.

Ted Cruz is acting like a jerk. Does he indulge in hiring illegal aliens for domestic help, practice domestic violence, have skeletons in his closet, etc etc. If so, send him back to Texas and better still to Canada. Texas can send Penelope Cruz to the senate instead.

Just the latest Chickenhawk, accusing others of his own failings. By his logic we should all be asking what foreign country is Cruz himself representing and who is he accepting money from.

Remember when Saxby Chambliss implied triple amputee Max Cleland was a friend of Osama's? These people are dispicable. But they may find the public less easy to push around with their lies, thanks to the internet.

For Mr. Cruz to attack Sen. Kerry, and Sen. Hagel on their service records as a just appointed Senator, and I will add he was a 4 year old chlld as the helicopters lifted off the US  Embassy in Saigon, he is really out of his waters here. He needs to read up on the Vietnam era, and the changes the world felt.
There is no or little common ground between the mainstream parties and  Senator Cruz is the first of his kind in recent memory.

The great irony in all these people throwing out charges of "McCarthyism" is that McCarthy was ultimately proven to be 100% correct on the 108 people from the State Department that he accused of either being spies or security risks due to their association with the Communist Party and Communist agents.  In fact is has been written about in this very newspaper.

"Mr. Cruz, who also questioned the commitment of Mr. Kerry and Mr. Hagel to the armed forces, though both served in Vietnam. Mr. Cruz has no record of military service."

NYT--get a clue. Kerry's service in Vietnam was voided with his lies and slander in front of Congress accusing his fellow soldiers of atrocities that had no more foundation in fact than Cruz's accusations against Hagel. Hagel has similarly been more than willing to agree with those who accuse the US of abusing its power around the globe. Neither deserves a cabinet position of any import. It's unfortunate that Kerry, who is no better than Hanoi Jane, is now our Secretary of State instead of relegated to a back bench, low level Senate committee membership where his tendency to side with our enemies would have less impact on the future security of our country. I'd take Senator Cruz's patriotism and dedication to this country far more seriously than either Kerry's or Hagel's.

The biggest embarrassment is that the voters of Texas aren't embarrassed by electing this obnoxious dolt.  They have six years to realize the harm they have wrought on the nation.  Hopefully, Cruz will fade like all the other flakes of the month the GOP has put on stage.  Unfortunately, the media will probably continue to spotlight his foolishness, just like they did Joseph McCarthy.

Aside from Senator Cruz, it must be remembered that McCathyism is now a misleading term to condemn a false accuser. As a 2004 article published by the Claremont Institute states: "[T]hanks to the insistence of the late Democratic Senator Daniel Patrick Moynihan of New York. . . . some 2,900 documents collectively known as "the Venona papers" . . . were de-classified and published. These were radio messages from the top KGB agents in Washington and New York to their superiors in Moscow from approximately 1943 to 1948. They had been recorded at the time by the U.S. Army Signal Corps.

"The Venona papers, together with . . . [Soviet] archives, made it absolutely clear that . . . by 1945 every important branch of the American government, from the White House itself to the State Department, the Defense Department, the Justice Department, the Treasury Department, the Office of Strategic Services (predecessor to the CIA), and the Office of War Information, to name only a few, was infested with Communists busily doing the work of the Soviet Union."

Senator McCarthy was reckless but, on balance, the Venona Papers and Soviet Archives prove him correct in his overall allegations.

He's following the only MO that many in  his party evidently embrace: say no to anything and everything proposed by the President (who cares if it hurts the nation).  And he's going about it with the same stance of anger and bullying that has cast this party as ever so unlikable and un-vote-able. Whatever happened to all that big Texas about seceding anyway?
Something my mother used to say about empty barrels making the most noise, seems to apply here.
Tell that to Harry Reid who accused Romney of not paying taxes with no evidence.  And then when evidence came out that he in fact paid over 15% every year for 10 years, did Harry Reid apologize?  No.
Hispanic is not a race.
Hispanic is not a race, for starters. Mr. Cruz is half Cuban on his father's side, and Irish-American on his mother' side.

Ted Cruz is an embarrassment to me and other Democrats.in Texas.  He does not represent my Hispanic neighbors (I am Anglo).  He will follow the Republican pledge to take away funding for the children of his race in the interest of support the rich.
Janet, don't forget, he's not a junior Senator, he's a "very junior" Senator unlike our President when he ran for office. Love liberal logic.
The Democrats run the Senate, and have not passed a budget in 4 years.  Maybe they should get on with running the country?

Correction
Elizabeth Warren is now the Senior Senator from Massachussetts
